African swine fever has appeared
in 44 localities across the country,
including the southern region of the capital where
pig farming is becoming hot, forcing many provinces and
cities to urgently implement
prevention measures.  Preventing cholera from
spreading to local pig herds
in many localities with
large pig herds such as Dong Nai, Dong Thap, Tien
Giang, the epidemic is spreading rapidly, making
farmers worried when
preparing for Tet.  Very serious threat
to all livestock farms.
In the past, people thought that
epidemics would occur only on farms with poor biosecurity,
but now biosecurity is a problem.
Even in large corporations,
biosecurity has been broken. It is urgent to prevent
African swine fever. In addition to absolutely complying with
biosecurity in livestock farming,
vaccination is a stressful solution.  Most
importantly, the first country in the world has just
officially commercialized two types of vaccines to prevent
African swine fever. Vietnam is
trying to increase the rate of coverage of this vaccine to
livestock, with about 1.5 million doses so far.
vaccinated on a large scale. Currently, the
rate of vaccination against
African swine fever is still low. This is something that needs to be
improved to prevent the
spread of the disease and ensure supply stability
